review: Rounders is the story of a guy who is a great gambler and who could make a living on gambling by beating the casino and other players along the way. However, as luck would have it, he is forced into high stakes, he is forced to go back into the world that he tried to leave.This is were the movie takes off. Rounders (1998) used the technical kowledge of real rounders/pro-gamblers to pull off its sense of realism. However, it does this while balancing the law aspect of the story and while introducing us to great characters like John Malkovich and his Teddy KGB. You don't have to be a gambler to enjoy this film.In fact, I dont gamble much, but if you want to see how gambling can come down to the finest perceived detail or the edge of control, Rounders it for you, it will help you get into the mind-set and the physic of the game.Viewed on tape. Rating 9
